channel.title: Transcriptomics on CityU-Bioinformatics
channel.description: Recent content in Transcriptomics on CityU-Bioinformatics

item.title: Low-level RNA detection
item.description: Table of Contents DNA modification analysis Low-level RNA detection scRNA-seq analysis Noise reduction Transcript quantification Cell lineage and pseudotime inference Dimensionality reduction Single-cell qPCR dPCR DNA modification analysis Whole genome DNA methylation detection is one of the most important part of epigenetics research. It is supposed to have a great effect on cancers and tumors, and even be involved in the senility of human.

item.title: RNA Transcription
item.description: Table of Contents Transcription analysis Prognostic Biomarker Identification Region Discrimination Gene co-expression prediction Gene regulatory network inference Gene set enrichment analysis Over-representation analysisi RNA-seq analysis Read count Known transcript quantification Gene fusion detection Prognostic biomarker identification Differential expression Alternative splicing events identification CAGE Analysis TSS detection De novo motif discovery Gene expression array analysis Differential expression detection Time course Meta-analysis Metatranscriptomic sequencing analysis Prediction-base Taxonomic Homology-Based Taxonomic Transcription analysis Transcript abundance is in many ways an extraordinary phenotype, with special attributes that confer particular importance on an understanding of its genetics.
